entry.title: Suzanna Randall (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that astrophysicist Suzanna Randall (pictured) continued her research at the European Southern Observatory while training for the spaceflight programme Die Astronautin?

entry.title: Boggy Creek Monster (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the documentary Boggy Creek Monster, about the Fouke Monster, had its first screening at a middle school?

entry.title: Nigel Savage (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that environmental activist Nigel Savage created Hazon after googling "Jewish food movement" and receiving zero search results?

entry.title: March of the Soviet Militia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that "March of the Soviet Militia" by Dmitri Shostakovich was a "manifestation of conformity" that was "better not to remember"?

entry.title: Wait in the Truck (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Lainey Wilson said she hoped her duet with Hardy, "Wait in the Truck", haunted domestic abusers?

entry.title: Sarah Oakley (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in August 2022, Sarah Oakley became the first female captain to helm the passing out parade at Dartmouth?

entry.title: Yirgalem Fisseha Mebrahtu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Eritrean poet Yirgalem Fisseha Mebrahtu was imprisoned for six years without trial, and later published poems in Tigrinya based on her experience?

entry.title: in 2021 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that China limited online video games for children to three hours per week in 2021?
